title: Amelie and Friends typeface
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot%20-%209_14_2014%20,%206_31_10%20PM_5442.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot%20-%209_14_2014%20,%206_19_09%20PM_6525.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot%20-%209_14_2014%20,%206_24_32%20PM_4479.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot%20-%209_14_2014%20,%206_22_07%20PM_6179.png)

I can't seem to figure this one out. Any help would be greatly appreciated! ;)

Font: 

 Heavily modified Freshman by William Boyd 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: relic57

comments.content:
It resembles Brothers (Emigre) and Braingelt (Chank Diesel), but isn't either one.

Still looking....
Thank you so much for all your help! Wow, never had seen Braingelt! That is very close.

I Love Dust, the agency that designed the Amelia and Friends identity, uses a Lost Type typeface called Liberator on their site, so I thought maybe they used another Lost Type offering for Amelia.

So far, no matches.

Hopefully some other forum member will recognize it or know if it is a bespoke typeface.

Brothers is definitely an excellent alternative (some more after). I'm pretty convinced it's a custom, after having a look to their weibiste, from [Freshman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/www.dafont.com/freshman.font) (used for th rest of the online identity). Serifs has been edited (or chopped off) and turned into flared latin ones. /R leg has been transformed (/P + oblique leg)  
Some more in the same vein, not matching either: [Dealers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcreativemarket.com/Gumpita/49869-Dealers), usual LHF's [Roebuck](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/roebuck.php), [Antique Half Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/antiquehalfblock.php) and [Old Stock](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/letterheadfonts.com/fonts/oldstock.php), [Reidfork](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/creativemarket.com/swistblnk/75323-Reidfork), [Charcuterie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/charcuterie) Block, [Gin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fort-foundry/gin)

Quick'n'dirty job starting from Freshman

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_3846.png)
Wow, very good eye!!! I think you nailed it perfectly. Thank you so much for your help! The 'S' was was bothering me on this on since it was missing the serifs, now I know why. Awesome ID!
